page.title: 02POLLOK COUNTRY PARK GLASGOW
page.content: Pollok Country Park (146 hectacres) is three miles from Glasgow City Centre. The main entrance is 2O60 Pollokshaws Road. About one third of the park has been open to the public since l9ll. If you spend a day in the park you may visit Pollok House or the Burrell Collection. If you prefer the outdoor life you should visit the Ranger Centre or admire the beautiful flowers in the Demonstration Garden, e.g. scarlet lady, Glasgow glow, etc. There are also a wide variety of trees such as oak, apple and chestnut. Foxes ,rabbits, kestrels, deer and Highland cattle roam freely in the park. Within the confines of the city, the Park provides a range of educational and recreational activities of interest for all ages. The last bonus is that everything in in the park is {FREE}of charge.
